intro: Galactia augusti var. augusti, commonly known as the Augustus galactia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically white or pale pink, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in sandy or loamy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The plant is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
